 May 28 1500GMT

Hi Gordon,

I had a fine time listening this morning.
For whatever reason, I had no microphone, so didn't ask you anything.
Something skypish to do with your conference not working on a Mac, so I
cobbled some PC together in a few minutes.
I'll try to do better next time.

Much thanks for the crawl-delay in 1.15.
Not to mention all the out of memory repairs.

I also much like the idea of writing the frontier off to a log, and then 
crawling it.

I'll be starting my next run in a few days with it, I'll let you know how
the stress test does.  Bet I stress it more than most.  I have five 
broad crawlers
that are still running, from a November 2007 start.    A billion here, a 
billion there . . .
(Soon, yer a government)

I also applaud the trap taxonomy.  Yes, its useful, with a lot of room 
for development.

We likely need to develop a good syntax for all the behaviors,
e.g.
slow site.
never ending site.
intentional trap.
operator threatens to sue you if you crawl them, but has no robots.txt 
(The ID ten T trouble ticket certainly applies here)
ad farm site.
calendar broken site.  ( I love these ones.  Seem to be at a lot of 
universities.   Its always good to
know the faculty will still be having a meeting on advanced research on 
March 25, 2087)

We could certainly continue the 200, 300, 400, . . . numbering code on 
them, for example.
Much to think about, I won't write more here.

John

Gordon Mohr wrote:

> We're trying something new next week -- an open-to-all conference call
> to improve communication among the Heritrix-using web harvesting 
> community.
>
> If all goes well, other calls will follow -- after each major Heritrix
> release, and perhaps more often. We will also work to have calls in
> pairs, so that there are times convenient for both European and Pacific
> timezones.
>
> The first call will occur via a 'Skypecast', at the following time:
>
> 1500GMT Wednesday May 28th
> (8a San Francisco / 11a WashingtonDC / 4p London)
>
> The call will open with a brief overview of what's new in the latest
> Heritrix releases (1.14.0 and 2.0.0), and some of the priorities for
> future releases. Then, it will be an open discussion of whatever
> participants want to talk about.
>
> Participating in the Skypecast only requires a current version of Skype
> to participate, and accommodates up to 100 participants (with facilities
> for the moderator to rotate people into speaking positions).
>
> Everyone using or interested in web harvesting with Heritrix is welcome
> to participate. Latest info, including a link to the Skypecast page
> which allows joining the call, will live at this Heritrix wiki page:
>
> http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Community+Calls 
> <http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Community+Calls>
>
> Join us!
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
>
